alert.note: Alert for Haakon (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 11 at 9:38PM MDT until June 11 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM MDT FOR WEST CENTRAL HAAKON...SOUTHEASTERN MEADE AND NORTHEASTERN PENNINGTON COUNTIES... At 937 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles east of Elm Springs, or 39 miles northwest of Philip, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Wall, Union Center, Wasta, Enning, Elm Springs, Creighton, White Owl, Wicksville, Curlew Lake and Viewfield. This includes Interstate 90 in South Dakota between Mile Markers 86 and 113. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
